title: Vaccine Protocols
cleaned_text: Health Care Provider Resources [Contact Info](#) Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Contact Info Infectious Disease Epidemiology, Prevention and Control Division 651-201-5414 Last Updated: 08/31/2023 Refer to Vaccine Protocols Information and templates for writing a vaccine administration order, also called a protocol. [Subscribe](javascript:window.open('http://service.govdelivery.com/service/subscribe.html?code=MNMDH_137','Popup','width=700,height=440,toolbar=no,scrollbars=yes,resizable=yes'); void('');) to Vaccine Protocols to receive an email every time a protocol is updated or added to the page. On this page: Guidance Documents [Guidance for Adopting Vaccine Protocols (PDF)](/people/immunize/hcp/protocols/protocolguide.pdf) Information on why vaccine protocols are necessary, why there are so many protocols, annual signing of protocols, and how to get started. [CDC: Vaccine Exipient Summary](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/pubs/pinkbook/downloads/appendices/b/excipient-table-2.pdf) List excipients included in U.S. vaccines, by vaccine, to help determine potential allergens. Supporting Resources [Vaccine Product Summary (PDF)](/people/immunize/hcp/vaxprodsum.pdf) Summary chart showing each vaccine's generic and brand names, manufacturer, age group licensed to receive, dosing information, and administration route. [Immunize.org: Guide to Contraindications and Precautions to Commonly Used Vaccines (PDF)](https://www.immunize.org/catg.d/p3072a.pdf) Guide designed to help immunization providers determine what common symptoms and conditions should contraindicate vaccination and which ones should not. [CDC: Vaccine Recommendations and Guidelines for Timing and Spacing of Immunobiologics](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/acip-recs/general-recs/timing.html) Best practice guidance of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP). Vaccine Protocol Templates Vaccine protocol templates to be filled in and used.
